org.cpsolver.exam.heuristics

Class ExamConstruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context.NeighbourSelectionWithContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamConstruction.Context>
      • org.cpsolver.exam.heuristics.ExamConstruction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanHoldContext, HasAssignmentContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamConstruction.Context>, NeighbourSelection<Exam,ExamPlacement>

    public class ExamConstruction
extends NeighbourSelectionWithContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamConstruction.Context>
    Initial solution construction heuristics.

    While there are exams that are still not assigned:
    • The worst unassigned exam is selected (using Exam.compareTo(Exam))
    • The best period that does not break any hard constraint and for which there is a room assignment available is selected together with the set the best available rooms for the exam in the best period (computed using Exam.findBestAvailableRooms(Assignment, ExamPeriodPlacement)).


    If problem property ExamConstruction.CheckLocalOptimality is true, local (time) optimality is enforced at the end of this phase. During this procedure, for each exam, it tries to change the period of the exam so that the time cost is lower (see ExamPlacement.getTimeCost(Assignment)), but no hard constraint is violated. The problem is considered locally optimal if there is no such move.

    Version:
    ExamTT 1.3 (Examination Timetabling)

      • checkLocalOptimality

        public Neighbour<Exam,ExamPlacement> checkLocalOptimality(Assignment<Exam,ExamPlacement> assignment,
                                                          ExamModel model)
        Find a new assignment of one of the assigned exams that improves the time cost ExamPlacement.getTimeCost(Assignment) and for which there is a set of available rooms Exam.findBestAvailableRooms(Assignment, ExamPeriodPlacement). Return null, if there is no such assignment (the problem is considered locally optimal).
        Parameters:
        assignment - current assignment
        model - problem model
        Returns:
        a neighbour to assign or null if none was found

      • selectNeighbour

        public Neighbour<Exam,ExamPlacement> selectNeighbour(Solution<Exam,ExamPlacement> solution)
        Select a neighbour. While there are exams that are still not assigned:
        • The worst unassigned exam is selected (using Exam.compareTo(Exam))
        • The best period that does not break any hard constraint and for which there is a room assignment available is selected together with the set the best available rooms for the exam in the best period (computed using Exam.findBestAvailableRooms(Assignment, ExamPeriodPlacement)).
        Return null when done (all variables are assigned and the problem is locally optimal).
        Parameters:
        solution - given solution
        Returns:
        a neighbour assignment

      • createAssignmentContext

        public ExamConstruction.Context createAssignmentContext(Assignment<Exam,ExamPlacement> assignment)
        Description copied from interface: HasAssignmentContext
        Create a new assignment context for the given assignment. If there are already some variables assigned in the value, the method should make sure that the context is appropriately initialized.
        Parameters:
        assignment - an assignment for which there needs to be an assignment context
        Returns:
        a new instance of the assignment context, filled according to the given assignment
